paper_abstract: The present study proposes topology optimization of a micro-structure for composites considering the macroscopic structural response, applying a decoupling multiscale analysis based on a homogenization approach. In this study, it is assumed that topology of macro-structure is unchanged and that topology of micro-structure is unique over the macro-structure. The stiffness of the macrostructure is maximized with a prescribed material volume of constituents under linear elastic regime. A gradient-based optimization strategy is applied and an analytical sensitivity approach based on numerical material tests is introduced. It was verified from a series of numerical examples that the proposed method has great potential for advanced material design.
paper_title: Topology optimization of micro-structure for composites applying a decoupling multi-scale analysis
